{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3418321,"name":"Kevin Thompson (mentor)","username":"kevintheengineer","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/k/91b2a8/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-08-27T01:50:53.066Z","cooked":"

Does anyone know the process for getting a new motor approved?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2024-08-27T01:50:53.066Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":70,"reads":704,"readers_count":703,"score":505.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":470309,"topic_slug":"new-motor-approval-process","display_username":"Kevin Thompson (mentor)","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":60460,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/new-motor-approval-process/470309/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1},{"id":"thinking","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3418330,"name":"EricH","username":"EricH","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/erich/{size}/128938_2.png","created_at":"2024-08-27T02:39:05.574Z","cooked":"

Start by contacting HQ. I would probably contact frcteams (at) firstinspires.org, say ‚ÄúI have a motor for FRC that I‚Äôd like to get approved, can you put me in contact with the people that do that?‚Äù, and wait for a transfer to the KOP team or equivalent.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2024-08-27T02:39:05.574Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":684,"readers_count":683,"score":146.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":470309,"topic_slug":"new-motor-approval-process","display_username":"EricH","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"http://firstinspires.org","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"FIRST | For Inspiration and Recognition of Science and Technology","clicks":5}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":4212,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"#westandwithUkraine"},"post_url":"/t/new-motor-approval-process/470309/2","custom_user_title":"#westandwithUkraine","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3418331,"name":"Billfred Leverette (he/him/not Bill)","username":"Billfred","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/billfred/{size}/225278_2.png","created_at":"2024-08-27T02:40:39.119Z","cooked":"

Generally, it involves a dialogue with the Kit of Parts staff. Only they know the particulars, but if you email frcparts@firstinspires.org I‚Äôm sure they‚Äôd be happy to discuss it (if, perhaps, for 2026 given the timetable).

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2024-08-27T02:40:39.119Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":678,"readers_count":677,"score":175.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":470309,"topic_slug":"new-motor-approval-process","display_username":"Billfred Leverette (he/him/not Bill)","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":true,"admin":false,"staff":true,"user_id":3095,"hidden":false,"trust_level":4,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"says you should come to SCRIW in October"},"post_url":"/t/new-motor-approval-process/470309/3","custom_user_title":"says you should come to SCRIW in October","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3418536,"name":"Kevin Thompson (mentor)","username":"kevintheengineer","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/k/91b2a8/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-08-27T19:17:05.585Z","cooked":"

The exact type of motor I would like to have available for FRC is a MDR (Motor Driven Roller). There are 3 major competitors in the market and they all have these motors in stock in various lengths (Widths depending on design).

pulseroller.com

Motor Roller (MDR)

Pulseroller Site

https://itohdenki.com/products/dc-rollers

https://www.interroll.com/products/unit-handling/drives/

The 1.9" diameter roller is a standard size in the industry. 24v, up to 48watts output, 2.5amps, available in multiple lengths.

Online price roughly $300.

I am not sure the price is worth the effort to bring these into the FRC. The idea opens up some options for specific intake or discharge designs.

I do have contacts in the industry which could offer significant discounts if we approached them. The axel can be bolted or attached with a nut or left as a hex shaft.

thoughts?

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2024-08-27T19:17:05.585Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":563,"readers_count":562,"score":127.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":470309,"topic_slug":"new-motor-approval-process","display_username":"Kevin Thompson (mentor)","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.pulseroller.com/products/24-volt/senergy-senergy-ai-drives/motor-roller","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Motor Roller (MDR)","clicks":182},{"url":"https://itohdenki.com/products/dc-rollers","internal":false,"reflection":false,"clicks":37},{"url":"https://www.interroll.com/products/unit-handling/drives/","internal":false,"reflection":false,"clicks":20}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":60460,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/new-motor-approval-process/470309/4","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3418551,"name":"Billfred Leverette (he/him/not Bill)","username":"Billfred","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/billfred/{size}/225278_2.png","created_at":"2024-08-27T19:52:32.404Z","cooked":"

This seems like something that would‚Äôve been incredible a decade ago, but it doesn‚Äôt have quite the same punch in modern day FRC.

Like, I love the packaging. But:

  • 48W is peanuts for a motor in modern FRC. 200-300W is easily found across a lot of small-can motors (NEO 550, 775pro, RedLine, etc) for a modest packaging penalty.
  • Modern FRC has a basic understanding of the allowed brutality of intakes and conveyors, so there‚Äôs little incentive to rein in the power there.
  • If it‚Äôs already behind the competition norms in a 24V system, I am nervous about performance at 12V.
  • And like you suspect, I can‚Äôt remember the last newly-legal motor that didn‚Äôt come from a FIRST supplier. Which means FIRST either got them donated or for a very nice price.

That said, shooters shoot. Make the connection and who knows what‚Äôll happen!

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2024-08-27T19:52:32.404Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":486,"readers_count":485,"score":237.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":470309,"topic_slug":"new-motor-approval-process","display_username":"Billfred Leverette (he/him/not Bill)","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":60460,"username":"kevintheengineer","name":"Kevin Thompson (mentor)","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/k/91b2a8/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":8}],"moderator":true,"admin":false,"staff":true,"user_id":3095,"hidden":false,"trust_level":4,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"says you should come to SCRIW in October"},"post_url":"/t/new-motor-approval-process/470309/5","custom_user_title":"says you should come to SCRIW in October","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":8}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":8,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3418557,"name":"Kevin Thompson (mentor)","username":"kevintheengineer","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/k/91b2a8/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-08-27T20:11:14.951Z","cooked":"

Thank you! FYI- I am a mechanical / design guy. The watts and motor output are a mystery to me. These MDR units push 70 pound boxes down a line at many different speeds. I am miss representing something if what I said means they lack power. I have tried to contact anyone at FRC since the middle of last year. I think I may actually pick up the phone and call them.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2024-08-27T20:11:14.951Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":9,"reads":448,"readers_count":447,"score":144.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":470309,"topic_slug":"new-motor-approval-process","display_username":"Kevin Thompson (mentor)","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":3095,"username":"Billfred","name":"Billfred Leverette (he/him/not Bill)","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/billfred/{size}/225278_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":60460,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/new-motor-approval-process/470309/6","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3418570,"name":"Anand Rajamani","username":"asid61","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/asid61/{size}/7179_2.png","created_at":"2024-08-27T21:10:51.381Z","cooked":"

Motor selection is a handy skill to have. 48W of output power is enough for keeping boxes moving, but it‚Äôs not a lot when it comes to accelerating FRC objects from a stop. Accelerating a 1lb object from 0 to 10mph would take 10J of energy assuming it operates at peak power the whole time (which it will not). At 48W that‚Äôs a minimum of 0.2sec, probably closer to 0.5sec after accounting for the lower power output at stall. That‚Äôs not that fast for an intake. If it was cheap it would be good for rookies, but teams with $300 are going to pick a Kraken with a gearbox first. That‚Äôs not including the speed controller interface.

I thought you had a contact willing to donate these - FIRST is highly unlikely to approve a motor that teams purchase from an unknown 3rd party.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2024-08-27T21:11:12.139Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":421,"readers_count":420,"score":164.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":470309,"topic_slug":"new-motor-approval-process","display_username":"Anand Rajamani","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":60460,"username":"kevintheengineer","name":"Kevin Thompson (mentor)","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/k/91b2a8/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":5}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":21715,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/new-motor-approval-process/470309/7","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":5}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":5,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3418588,"name":"Frank Lima","username":"franklima260","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/franklima260/{size}/4291_2.png","created_at":"2024-08-27T21:57:04.774Z","cooked":"

Mechanical power (Watts) = angular velocity (Rad/S) * Torque (N*m)

Mechanical power is a really useful number for sizing a motor in a system. Here is a basic motor selection workflow:

docs.revrobotics.com

Choosing an Actuator | DUO Build System

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2024-08-27T22:08:20.668Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":388,"readers_count":387,"score":92.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":470309,"topic_slug":"new-motor-approval-process","display_username":"Frank Lima","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://docs.revrobotics.com/duo-build/motion/actuators","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Choosing an Actuator | DUO Build System","clicks":17}],"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":60460,"username":"kevintheengineer","name":"Kevin Thompson (mentor)","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/k/91b2a8/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":12457,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"1745 Mentor | REV Robotics M.E."},"post_url":"/t/new-motor-approval-process/470309/8","custom_user_title":"1745 Mentor | REV Robotics M.E.","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3418593,"name":"Max Vrany","username":"cgmv123","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/cgmv123/{size}/5342_2.png","created_at":"2024-08-27T22:50:34.148Z","cooked":"

Finding someone willing to donate a significant quantity for the kit of parts will help a lot.

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2024-08-27T22:50:34.148Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":347,"readers_count":346,"score":69.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":470309,"topic_slug":"new-motor-approval-process","display_username":"Max Vrany","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":15810,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"FRC Robot Inspector/FLL Tournament Director"},"post_url":"/t/new-motor-approval-process/470309/9","custom_user_title":"FRC Robot Inspector/FLL Tournament Director","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3418604,"name":"Matt Golman","username":"BordomBeThyName","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/bordombethyname/{size}/147649_2.png","created_at":"2024-08-27T23:48:30.475Z","cooked":"

I‚Äôve done a small amount of work in material handling, and a large amount of work in FRC. Those roller motors are very cool, but poorly suited for FRC.

All of the options you linked are 24/48VDC which means that on FRC‚Äôs standard 12V, they‚Äôll run at half their rated speed and torque.

They also all top out at 50W at their rated voltages, which would already make them some of the weakest motors on the legal motor list. Once you de-rate a 24V motor to 12V, its peak power output will drop by 3/4, to just 12.5W. The current weakest motor in FRC is the AM NeverRest at 14W, which I have never once seen on a robot.

The Pulseroller site has a weight table which shows that rollers wide enough for a good intake (600mm) are about 5lb each, which is a pretty hefty bite out of your allowed 125. That figure gets even worse when you consider that most intakes require 2-3 rollers. They also have to be actuated in and out, and raising the weight of the intake rollers means increasing the power requirements of the motor doing that actuation.

These rollers are also (as you noted) $300 each, and their primary use case would put them outside the frame perimeter, in the direction of travel of the robot. That means that a high speed robot collision could destroy $900 worth of motors.

On the cost front, assuming I‚Äôm reading this site correctly, that $300 buys you just the motor, which means you still need a speed controller for it. Assuming you can pair it with a Victor SPX (the cheapest controller you can buy right now? I think?), that‚Äôs an extra $50 per roller.

In short, I love the idea but this isn‚Äôt a product well suited to our use case.

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2024-08-27T23:48:30.475Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":333,"readers_count":332,"score":296.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":470309,"topic_slug":"new-motor-approval-process","display_username":"Matt Golman","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":11}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":9246,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Retired üå¥"},"post_url":"/t/new-motor-approval-process/470309/10","custom_user_title":"Retired üå¥","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":11}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":11,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3418894,"name":"Gus Michel II","username":"GeeTwo","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/geetwo/{size}/120962_2.png","created_at":"2024-08-28T21:25:45.262Z","cooked":"
BordomBeThyName:

the AM NeverRest at 14W, which I have never once seen on a robot

Right there, about six inches above the T in the FIRST logo. All it did was push the gear out through the spring hinged doors onto the peg, which it did adequately once we fixed the software (Thanks yet again, @ExploitSage!). We used it because we couldn‚Äôt find an FRC-legal servo with enough torque, and it already had the gearbox and encoder integrated, very much an edge case. I‚Äôd never want to use the NeveRest to actually lift anything at FRC scale, and certainly not on an intake.

Photo of Wolfgang, FRC 3946's 2017 robot3500√ó3500 2.72 MB

(Added)
Curiously, @ExploitSage and I were talking about a rebuild of this robot a year or ago as a robot for a one week programming boot camp because it has two good simple mechanisms, both of which scream for a sensor feedback loop. The gear hanger because the drive team couldn‚Äôt always see the robot as it hangs gears, depending on the peg; and stopping at the top of the davit was a thing that had to happen at the exact right time if you wanted to save your climbing rope and get off the rope at all conveniently. Further, the climber we built really should (and did) have a third sensor, a limit switch, to keep the climber mechanism (totally hidden in the photo behind the starboard control panel) inside the frame perimeter.
I did a bit of research into specs of currently legal gear motors available with integrated encoders this evening. If I actually build this soon (on the table), the new NR 50.9:1 looks like it‚Äôs in near tie for torque and speed with several other ~25W gear motors with encoders, and beats them all out for mount-ability and easy compatibility with the RIO - for SECOND. The clear winner for ease of integration, cost, and definitely being more than adequate is the AndyMark PG (Planetary Gearbox) motor, which is updated from 2017 with an integrated encoder, a half inch hex shaft, and likely more that I wasn‚Äôt interested in for this application. I was kind of torn between the 27:1 and the 91:1, until I remembered that there was some unused volume inside the robot, and I could use a belt reduction or increase which would also bring the gearbox, motor, encoder, and wiring all well inside the frame. So, I‚Äôd use the PG 27:1 (not because it‚Äôs a dollar cheaper, but because it‚Äôs wasteful to reduce and then increase gear ratio) and reduce another 4:3 or 3:2 with a belt drive. And oh yes, driving the polycarbonate scoosh from a hex shaft will be much easier and more robust than the 6mm and 1/4" shafts we used seven and a half years ago.

Thanks to everyone for the help. I contacted firstroboticscompetition@firstinspires.org. They replied the next day.
Basically they said it‚Äôs not worth adding these type of drives.

  1. Price per part plus controller not beneficial
  2. Weight of part is high
  3. Power the rollers produce is low.

No need to wonder or question now. Thanks for all the feedback.

kevintheengineer:

No need to wonder or question now. Thanks for all the feedback.

Thank you for asking the question! Sometimes talking out a ‚Äúbad idea‚Äù (heavy double bonus air quotes) is how someone else‚Äôs ‚Äúgood idea‚Äù (ditto) gets empowered to start the process.
